JUDGES: Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Renate Jaeger;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: The applicant , Mr Svatopluk Pečenka , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in PERSON . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Mr PERSON , from ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

In a judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG ( okresní soud ) , following the applicant ’s action of DATE , ordered an agricultural and commercial cooperative in liquidation to pay CZK CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL ( EUR CARDINAL ) to the applicant . On DATE ORG ( krajský soud ) upheld the first instance judgment which became final on DATE .

On DATE and DATE respectively , the defendant paid CZK CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL ( EUR CARDINAL ) and CZK CARDINAL ( ORG CARDINAL ) to the applicant who , on DATE , applied to ORG for enforcement of the above judgment by way of the compulsory satisfaction of the claim in the amount of CZK CARDINAL,CARDINAL ( ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL ) from the defendant ’s bank ’s account . On DATE the court ordered the enforcement . The order became final on DATE .

On DATE the applicant informed ORG that the bank had not yet paid him anything from the defendant ’s account . By a letter of DATE the bank informed him that on DATE it had transferred CZK MONEY ( EUR FAC ) to his account .
On DATE the enforcement proceedings terminated under LAW .
On DATE ORG ( krajský obchodní soud ) declared the defendant bankrupt .
On DATE the applicant submitted his unsettled claims of CZK CARDINAL,CARDINAL CZK ( EUR CARDINAL ) against the bankrupt ’s estate .

On DATE ORG adopted a resolution to distribute the bankrupt ’s estate , the applicant being granted ORG ( ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL ) . On DATE the applicant appealed to ORG ( vrchní soud ) . It appears that the proceedings are still pending .
Law no . DATE on ORG liability for damage caused in the exercise of public authority by an irregularity in a decision or the conduct of proceedings

Section PERSON ) as in force until DATE provided that the ORG was liable for damage caused by an irregularity in the conduct of proceedings , including non - compliance with the obligation to perform an act or give a decision within the statutory time - limit . Under section CARDINAL ) a person who had suffered loss on account of such an irregularity was entitled to damages .

On DATE CARDINAL Act no . DATE entered into force amending , inter alia , section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) which newly provides that the ORG is liable for damage caused by an irregularity in the conduct of proceedings , including non - compliance with the obligation to perform an act or give a decision within the statutory time - limit . If the law does not fix a time - limit for these purposes , it is considered that a violation of the duty to perform the act or give the decision within a reasonable time - limit is also considered as an irregularity in the conduct of proceedings . When using the notion of “ reasonable time ” , the LAW refers to ORG and CARDINAL of the Convention .

Act no . DATE also introduced a new section CARDINALa which provides for a reasonable satisfaction for moral prejudice caused by an irregularity in the conduct of proceedings including non - compliance with the obligation to perform an act or to adopt a decision within a reasonable time .

Under LAW the court shall notify the entitled party and the financial institution of the finality of the resolution whereby it has ordered the enforcement of a decision ; it shall serve the notification on the financial institution by personal delivery .

Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL provides , inter alia , that if the receivable being recovered , and incidentals thereto , the debt has not been paid in full , the financial institution shall carry out the enforcement of the decision also on DATE following DATE on which such an amount of funds is credited to the account , which is required for the entitled party ’s full satisfaction . If the above does not take place within DATE of the service of the notification under LAW , the financial institution shall carry out the enforcement from additionally credited funds also on DATE that follows the expiry of the above period of time , or , as applicable shall notify the entitled person that no funds were in the liable party ’s account . The financial institution shall debit the receivable to the account , and pay it to the entitled person , also if such funds do not suffice to satisfy the entitled party in full .
